body.p: To his excelency the governor of Ky. Beriah Magoffin

Your petitioner Henry Prather was fined on th 8th day of July 1861, before Squire Cocks a Justice of the peace of Mercer County, twenty dollars, for an assault and batery Prather is a man not addicted to quarrels or difficulties Never before had a dificulty with any person. He is a young man of good character, but poor, and if compelled to pay the fine and the cost attendant upon it. will be greatly oppressed your petitioner is a poor and hardworking man He pledged himself if relieced from this fine not to get into another dificulty if it can possibly be avoided
He further says that that the Jury who fined him say at the bottom of this petitiion that he should be released
Your Petitioner says the above statements are true.
sworn to Before me this the 20th day of August 1861 Wm M Bowen J P A C _ _
We the undersigned Jurors Join in the above petition and pray that said fines be remited.

E. N. Hedger
William Cacter
Mitchael Etherinton
Wm F Caruthers
William Craig
